name: http://linksys.com/jnap/routermanagement/RouterManagement
desc: This service provides access to a router's management settings.

GetManagementSettings.name: http://linksys.com/jnap/routermanagement/GetManagementSettings
GetManagementSettings.desc: This service provides access to a router's management settings. This action gets the router's current management settings.

canManageUsingHTTP.desc: Whether clients on the LAN can manage the router over HTTP.

canManageUsingHTTPS.desc: Whether clients on the LAN can manage the router over HTTPS.

canManageWirelessly.desc: Whether clients connected wirelessly to the LAN can manage the router.

canManageRemotely.desc: Whether clients on the WAN can manage the router.

GetRemoteManagementStatus.name: http://linksys.com/jnap/routermanagement/GetRemoteManagementStatus
GetRemoteManagementStatus.desc: This action gets the router's remote management service status.

serviceState.desc: The current state of the remote management service.

SetManagementSettings.name: http://linksys.com/jnap/routermanagement/SetManagementSettings
SetManagementSettings.desc: This action sets the router's management settings.

canManageUsingHTTP.desc: Whether clients on the LAN should be able to manage the router over HTTP. If the value of this parameter is false, the value of the canManageUsingHTTPS parameter must be true.

canManageUsingHTTPS.desc: Whether clients on the LAN should be able to manage the router over HTTPS. If the value of this parameter is false, the value of the canManageUsingHTTP parameter must be true.

canManageWirelessly.desc: Whether clients connected wirelessly to the LAN should be able to manage the router.

canManageRemotely.desc: Whether clients should be allowed to manage the router from the WAN. Note that the GetRemoteManagementServiceStatus action should be used to determine if remote management is possible as various issues, such as connection problems, could still prevent remote management.

errors.ErrorCannotDisableLocalConfiguration: The canManageUsingHTTP and canManageUsingHTTPS parameters were both specified as false, which would disable all ability to manage the router from the LAN.

RemoteManagementServiceState.AdministrativelyDisabled: The remote management service is administratively disabled. This value is returned when the canManageRemotely value of GetManagementSettings is false.
RemoteManagementServiceState.Stopped: The remote management service is not running. This value will be returned if the WAN connection is down.
RemoteManagementServiceState.Connecting: The remote management service is attempting to connect with the external (cloud) servers.
RemoteManagementServiceState.Connected: The remote management service is connected. Remote management is only possible in this state.
